museums.name: National Museum of India
museums.description: India's premier cultural institution housing over 200,000 artifacts spanning 5,000 years of Indian heritage and art.

museums.name: Salar Jung Museum
museums.description: One of the three National Museums of India housing the world's largest one-man collection of antiques and art treasures.

museums.name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya
museums.description: Formerly known as Prince of Wales Museum, this iconic institution houses art, archaeology, and natural history collections.

museums.name: Indian Museum
museums.description: The oldest and largest museum in India established in 1814, with rare collections of antiques, armor, ornaments, fossils, and Mughal paintings.

museums.name: Victoria Memorial Hall
museums.description: A magnificent marble building dedicated to Queen Victoria, housing paintings, sculptures, and artifacts from the British colonial period.

museums.name: National Rail Museum
museums.description: A museum focused on the rail heritage of India, displaying locomotives, coaches, saloons, and railway artifacts.

museums.name: Calico Museum of Textiles
museums.description: One of the finest textile museums in the world with an outstanding collection of Indian fabrics dating back to the 17th century.

museums.name: Government Museum Chennai
museums.description: The second oldest museum in India with rich collections of archaeology, numismatics, zoology, natural history, and sculptures.

museums.name: Jaipur City Palace Museum
museums.description: A stunning blend of Rajasthani and Mughal architecture, housing royal costumes, weapons, manuscripts, and artworks of the Maharajas.

museums.name: Dr. Bhau Daji Lad Mumbai City Museum
museums.description: Mumbai's oldest museum showcasing the city's history, decorative arts, and 19th-century industrial arts collection.

museums.name: National Gallery of Modern Art
museums.description: India's premier art gallery showcasing modern and contemporary Indian art from the 1850s onwards.

museums.name: Sanskriti Museums
museums.description: A complex of three museums dedicated to Indian textiles, everyday objects, and terracotta traditions.

museums.name: Kiran Nadar Museum of Art
museums.description: India's first private museum dedicated to modern and contemporary art with rotating exhibitions and educational programs.

museums.name: Maharaja Sawai Man Singh II Museum
museums.description: Located in the City Palace complex, this museum displays royal artifacts, textiles, weapons, and manuscripts of the Jaipur royal family.

museums.name: Gandhi Memorial Museum
museums.description: A museum dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi, housing the blood-stained garment worn by him when he was assassinated.

museums.name: Napier Museum
museums.description: A heritage museum with a natural air conditioning system, housing a rare collection of archaeological and historical artifacts.

museums.name: Visvesvaraya Industrial & Technological Museum
museums.description: A science and technology museum with interactive exhibits on engines, electricity, biotechnology, and space.

museums.name: Crafts Museum
museums.description: A museum showcasing India's diverse handloom and handicraft traditions with live demonstrations by craftspeople.

museums.name: Aga Khan Palace & Gandhi National Memorial
museums.description: A historical building where Mahatma Gandhi was interned during the Quit India Movement, now housing his memorabilia.

museums.name: Kerala Folklore Museum
museums.description: A privately owned architectural museum showcasing the rich cultural heritage of Kerala through artifacts, performing arts, and architecture.

museums.name: Tribal Museum
museums.description: A unique museum dedicated to the tribal heritage of Madhya Pradesh, showcasing their art, culture, and lifestyle.

museums.name: Partition Museum
museums.description: The world's first museum dedicated to preserving the memories and artifacts of the Partition of India in 1947.

museums.name: Sudha Cars Museum
museums.description: A unique museum showcasing handmade cars and motorcycles in various shapes like cameras, burgers, toilets, and more.

museums.name: Shankar's International Dolls Museum
museums.description: A museum housing over 6,500 dolls from over 85 countries, showcasing various costumes, traditions, and cultures.

museums.name: Nehru Science Centre
museums.description: India's largest interactive science center with over 500 hands-on exhibits on energy, sound, mechanics, and more.

museums.name: Dakshinachitra Museum
museums.description: A living history museum dedicated to South Indian heritage and culture, with traditional houses, art, and craft demonstrations.

museums.name: Srimanta Sankaradeva Kalakshetra
museums.description: A cultural institution showcasing the rich cultural heritage of Assam and the Northeast, with a museum, library, and art gallery.

museums.name: HAL Heritage Centre and Aerospace Museum
museums.description: India's first aerospace museum showcasing the growth of the Indian aviation industry and HAL for six decades.

museums.name: Anandwan - Maharogi Sewa Samiti
museums.description: A community founded by Baba Amte, showcasing a unique model of self-sustainability and rehabilitation for leprosy patients and the disabled.

museums.name: Manipur State Museum
museums.description: A museum showcasing the rich cultural heritage of Manipur, including tribal artifacts, royal costumes, and archaeological finds.

museums.name: INS Kursura Submarine Museum
museums.description: A decommissioned submarine of the Indian Navy turned into a museum on the beach, offering a glimpse into the life of submariners.
specialExhibitions: History of Indian Navy's Submarine Arm

museums.name: Umaid Bhawan Palace Museum
museums.description: A part of the magnificent Umaid Bhawan Palace, this museum showcases the royal history of Jodhpur with a collection of vintage cars, clocks, and photographs.

museums.name: Birla Industrial & Technological Museum
museums.description: The first science museum in India, with interactive galleries on physics, mathematics, life sciences, and technology.

museums.name: Lalbagh Botanical Garden & Glass House
museums.description: A nationally and internationally renowned centre for botanical artwork, scientific study of plants and also conservation of plants.

museums.name: Naval Aviation Museum
museums.description: A military museum showcasing the evolution of the Indian Naval Air Arm over the decades, with aircraft and memorabilia.

museums.name: Raja Dinkar Kelkar Museum
museums.description: A museum housing the collection of Dr. Dinkar G. Kelkar, dedicated to the memory of his only son, Raja. It has a collection of over 20,000 objects.

museums.name: Don Bosco Centre for Indigenous Cultures
museums.description: A major tourist spot in Shillong, it is a theme museum that showcases the rich culture of the indigenous people of Northeast India.

museums.name: Sanchi Archaeological Museum
museums.description: Located at the foothills of the Sanchi Stupa, this museum houses artifacts excavated from the site, including the Lion Capital of Ashoka.

museums.name: Jawahar Kala Kendra
museums.description: A multi-arts centre designed by architect Charles Correa, it houses art galleries, theatres, and a library, promoting the arts and crafts of Rajasthan.

museums.name: Patna Museum
museums.description: A repository of ancient artifacts from Bihar, including the famous Didarganj Yakshi and a collection of Buddhist sculptures.

museums.name: Vechaar at Vishalla
museums.description: A unique museum showcasing a vast collection of traditional Indian utensils, some dating back a thousand years.

museums.name: Folklore Museum Mysore
museums.description: A museum dedicated to the folk arts and crafts of Karnataka, with a rich collection of puppets, masks, and traditional artifacts.

museums.name: Mani Bhavan Gandhi Sangrahalaya
museums.description: A museum and research center dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi, located in the building where he stayed during his visits to Mumbai.

museums.name: Mayong Central Museum and Emporium
museums.description: A museum in the 'Land of Black Magic', showcasing ancient manuscripts, artifacts, and tools related to black magic and Ayurveda.

museums.name: Bhuri Singh Museum
museums.description: A museum housing a rich collection of artifacts related to the history, art, and culture of the Chamba region.

museums.name: L.D. Institute of Indology
museums.description: An institute and museum dedicated to the study and preservation of ancient Indian manuscripts, sculptures, and paintings.

museums.name: National Handicrafts and Handlooms Museum
museums.description: A museum showcasing the rich and diverse craft traditions of India, with a collection of textiles, pottery, woodwork, and more.

museums.name: Hall of Fame
museums.description: A museum constructed by the Indian Army in memory of the brave soldiers who lost their lives in the Indo-Pak wars.

museums.name: Government Museum and Art Gallery, Chandigarh
museums.description: A museum housing a rich collection of Gandharan sculptures, Pahari miniature paintings, and modern art, designed by Le Corbusier.

museums.name: World of Goa Museum
museums.description: A museum showcasing the history and culture of Goa through a collection of photographs, artifacts, and memorabilia.

museums.name: Allahabad Museum
museums.description: A national-level museum in Prayagraj, housing a rich collection of archaeological artifacts, natural history specimens, and art.

museums.name: Jatayu Earth's Center
museums.description: A rock-themed park featuring the world's largest bird sculpture, dedicated to the mythological bird Jatayu from the Ramayana.

museums.name: Karnataka Chitrakala Parishath
museums.description: A renowned art institution in Bangalore with a complex of art galleries, a graphic studio, and an open-air theatre.

museums.name: Heritage Transport Museum
museums.description: India's first comprehensive transport museum, showcasing the evolution of transportation in India.

museums.name: Siddhagiri Gramjivan Museum (Kaneri Math)
museums.description: A unique museum depicting the self-sufficient village life of Maharashtra before the invasion of Mughals, through life-size wax and cement statues.

museums.name: Dharohar Haryana Museum
museums.description: A museum showcasing the rich cultural, architectural, and archaeological heritage of Haryana.

museums.name: State Museum, Lucknow
museums.description: The oldest and largest multi-purpose museum in Uttar Pradesh, with collections of archaeological artifacts, coins, paintings, and natural history.

museums.name: Chittorgarh Fort Museum (Fateh Prakash Palace)
museums.description: Located within the historic Chittorgarh Fort, this museum houses a collection of sculptures, weapons, and artifacts from the Mewar region.

museums.name: Indira Gandhi Rashtriya Manav Sangrahalaya (IGRMS)
museums.description: An anthropological museum that presents the story of humankind in time and space, with open-air exhibitions of tribal habitats.

museums.name: Kite Museum
museums.description: A unique museum dedicated to the art and history of kite making, housing a collection of rare and beautiful kites from around the world.

museums.name: Albert Hall Museum
museums.description: The oldest museum of the state and functions as the state museum of Rajasthan. The building is a fine example of Indo-Saracenic architecture.

museums.name: Nizam's Museum
museums.description: A museum showcasing the gifts and souvenirs presented to the last Nizam of Hyderabad on the occasion of his silver jubilee celebrations.
specialExhibitions: History of the Asaf Jahi Dynasty

museums.name: CSK Vastu Sangrahalaya (Saraswati Mahal Library)
museums.description: One of the oldest libraries in Asia, housing a rare collection of palm-leaf manuscripts and paper written in Tamil, Sanskrit and other languages.

museums.name: Island Museum (Nagarjunakonda)
museums.description: An island museum in the middle of a man-made lake, housing Buddhist relics and artifacts excavated from the submerged Nagarjunakonda valley.

museums.name: Indian Museum of Arms and Armour (Mehrangarh Fort)
museums.description: Located within the Mehrangarh Fort, this museum has one of the finest collections of arms, armour, and cannons in India.

museums.name: State Museum, Ranchi
museums.description: A museum showcasing the history, culture, and tribal heritage of Jharkhand.

museums.name: Gandhi Smarak Sangrahalaya, Ahmedabad
museums.description: Located in the Sabarmati Ashram, this museum preserves the legacy of Mahatma Gandhi with a collection of his writings, photographs, and personal items.
highlights: My Life is My Message Gallery

museums.name: Ooty Tribal Research Center
museums.description: A research center and museum dedicated to the study and preservation of the tribal cultures of Tamil Nadu, particularly the Nilgiri tribes.

museums.name: Shivalik Fossil Park
museums.description: A unique park displaying life-size models of prehistoric animals that roamed the Shivalik hills, along with a collection of their fossils.

museums.name: Indian Air Force Museum, Palam
museums.description: A museum showcasing the history and achievements of the Indian Air Force, with a collection of aircraft, uniforms, and memorabilia.

museums.name: Science City, Kolkata
museums.description: A major attraction for science enthusiasts, this center has a Space Odyssey, Dynamotion Hall, and a large outdoor science park.

museums.name: Kutch Museum
museums.description: The oldest museum in Gujarat, housing a collection of Kshatrapa inscriptions, Kutchi silverwork, textiles, and archaeological finds.

museums.name: Anokhi Museum of Hand Printing
museums.description: A museum dedicated to the traditional art of hand block printing, housed in a beautifully restored haveli.

museums.name: Human Brain Museum
museums.description: A unique museum at NIMHANS, where visitors can see and even hold real human brains, showcasing various neurological conditions.

museums.name: War Memorial Museum, Amritsar
museums.description: A state-of-the-art museum showcasing the military history of Punjab and the sacrifices of its soldiers.

museums.name: Paldi Kite Museum
museums.description: Housed in the Sanskar Kendra, this museum showcases a vibrant collection of kites from various countries and of different shapes and sizes.
specialExhibitions: History of Kite Flying in Gujarat

museums.name: Jagdish Chandra Bose Aquarium
museums.description: A state-of-the-art aquarium with over 100 species of aquatic life, featuring a jellyfish pool, shark tank, and a multi-purpose underwater tunnel.

museums.name: Goa Chitra Museum
museums.description: An ethnographic museum showcasing the traditional agrarian technology and lifestyle of Goa through a collection of over 4000 artifacts.

museums.name: Loknath Museum
museums.description: A private museum showcasing a vast collection of traditional Odishan art forms including Pattachitra, palm-leaf etchings, and stone sculptures.

museums.name: Central Museum, Nagpur
museums.description: One of the oldest museums in Maharashtra, housing important artifacts from the Chalcolithic sites, ancient inscriptions, and a natural history collection.

museums.name: Urdu Ghar & Museum
museums.description: A center dedicated to the promotion of Urdu language and culture, with a museum showcasing calligraphy, manuscripts, and the history of Urdu literature.

museums.name: Salar Gunj Archeological Museum
museums.description: Also known as Victoria Jubilee Museum, it has a rich collection of sculptures, paintings, and artifacts of Buddhist and Hindu religions.

museums.name: Stok Palace Museum
museums.description: The museum at Stok Palace, the current residence of the former royal family of Ladakh, showcases royal artifacts, thangkas, and ceremonial costumes.

museums.name: Virupaksha Temple Museum
museums.description: A museum within the Virupaksha temple complex at Hampi, showcasing sculptures, coins, and artifacts from the Vijayanagara empire.
facilities: Located in a World Heritage Site

museums.name: Nehru Museum of Science and Technology
museums.description: Located in the IIT Kharagpur campus, this museum has numerous indoor and outdoor exhibits on science and technology, including a musical fountain.

museums.name: Indian Music Experience Museum
museums.description: Indias first interactive music museum, featuring hi-tech multimedia exhibits that showcase the diversity of Indian music, from traditional to contemporary.

museums.name: Odisha State Museum
museums.description: A comprehensive museum with a rich collection of manuscripts, sculptures, anthropological specimens, and natural history artifacts.

museums.name: Thirumalai Nayakkar Mahal
museums.description: A 17th-century palace erected by King Thirumalai Nayak. The palace has a museum section with artifacts and paintings from the Nayak dynasty.
highlights: Stucco Work on Domes and Arches

museums.name: Regional Science Centre & Planetarium, Calicut
museums.description: A popular science center with interactive galleries, a planetarium, and a 3D theater, aimed at promoting science education.

museums.name: Baba Bhaskar Sanskriti Sangrahalaya
museums.description: A museum dedicated to the cultural heritage of the Malwa region, with a collection of archaeological finds, manuscripts, and traditional art.

museums.name: Indian Museum of Horology (Clock Museum)
museums.description: A private museum showcasing a vast and eclectic collection of clocks and timepieces from different eras and countries.

museums.name: Netaji Birth Place Museum
museums.description: The ancestral home of Subhas Chandra Bose, converted into a museum that chronicles his life, ideals, and role in India's freedom struggle.

museums.name: Gass Forest Museum
museums.description: A natural history museum located within the Forest College Campus, showcasing a rich collection of forestry-related exhibits, timber products, and preserved animals.
specialExhibitions: Medicinal Plants of the Western Ghats

museums.name: Prakriti - The Rock and Mineral Museum
museums.description: A museum dedicated to geology, showcasing a wide variety of rocks, minerals, fossils, and semi-precious stones from the Himalayan region and beyond.

museums.name: Bay Island Maritime Museum
museums.description: A museum showcasing the rich marine life and history of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, with exhibits on corals, shells, and local tribal history.

museums.name: Laxmi Vilas Palace Museum
museums.description: The museum within the magnificent Laxmi Vilas Palace, showcasing an impressive collection of Raja Ravi Varma paintings, European art, and royal artifacts.

museums.name: Warangal Fort Archaeological Museum
museums.description: A museum situated within the Warangal Fort, displaying a collection of sculptures, inscriptions, and artifacts from the Kakatiya dynasty.

museums.name: Namgyal Institute of Tibetology
museums.description: A premier institute and museum for the study of Tibetan language and culture, housing a vast collection of rare manuscripts, thangkas, and statues.

museums.name: Mysore Rail Museum
museums.description: The second railway museum established in India, featuring vintage locomotives, royal coaches, and a gallery of railway memorabilia.

museums.name: International Roerich Memorial Trust
museums.description: The former residence of Russian artist Nicholas Roerich, now a museum and art gallery showcasing his paintings of the Himalayas and other works.
